questions.text: A 62-year-old man with diabetes, hypertension, and hyperlipidemia comes to the emergency department of medical center with chest pain, nausea, vomiting, and diaphoresis. An electrocardiogram demonstrates ST elevation in the anterior leads, and cardiac enzymes are markedly elevated. Investigators at the center are designing a randomized control trial to test the hypothesis that drug B will decrease the mortality associated with acute ST-elevation myocardial infarction compared to standard of care. To ensure that investigators will not miss a difference between drug B and standard of care (if a difference truly exists), which of the following would they want to maximize?

A 27-year-old woman was brought to the casualty in an unconscious state after having suddenly collapsed. As there was no pulse, cardiopulmonary resuscitation was started and the defibrillator showed the following. What is the next step?

A 35 year old female patient presents with lesions involving the axillary, inframammary, and inguinal creases as shown below. No scales are noted on examination. Which of the following types could be the diagnosis?
Identify the correct statement:

options.label: A
options.text: Safe motherhood services and cash for institutional delivery - Surakshit Matritva Abhiyan

options.label: B
options.text: Designed for training health personnel - Navjat Sishu Suraksha Karyakaram

options.label: C
options.text: Freedays by ASHA to adolescents - Kishori shakti yojana

questions.correct_answer: B. Designed for training health personnel - Navjat Sishu Suraksha Karyakaram
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Designed for training health personnel - Navjat Sishu Suraksha Karyakaram

questions.text: What is the size of the endotracheal tube and blade to be used for resuscitation of a preterm neonate with weight 1.8 kg not responding to PPV?
What is the correct sequence of steps in a randomized controlled trial? Blinding Randomization Defining inclusion and exclusion criteria Statistical analysis
All of the following apply to health propaganda except:

options.label: A
options.text: Knowledge and skills instilled in the minds

questions.text: A 64-year-old man comes to the OPD due to blisters on his trunk and groin. Itching has occurred for the past several weeks, and blisters developed a week ago. He has a history of hypertension and osteoarthritis. The patient received the zoster vaccine at age 60. Examination shows numerous 0.5- to 3-cm bullous skin lesions. The findings from a skin biopsy are shown in the image below. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

In a study investigating the impact of a dietary intervention on cholesterol levels, researchers enrolled 900 participants. After 3 months, the mean reduction in LDL cholesterol was found to be 20 mg/dL with a standard deviation of 3 mg/dL. What is the 95% confidence interval for the mean reduction in LDL cholesterol?
Which color of Venturi device will you use to administer a 40% concentration of oxygen to the patient?

A child was brought to a pediatrician with tense blisters, vesicles, and annular erythema. Immunofluorescence of the biopsy specimen is shown below. What is the first-line drug used in the management of this condition?
Match the following scientists with their discoveries:
Which of the following is the correct sequence for CPR in Basic life support?

options.label: A
options.text: Assess the patient's response, Activate ERS, check carotid pulse, Start CPR

options.label: B
options.text: Check carotid pulse, Start CPR, call for help and activate ERS, Defibrillate

options.label: C
options.text: Defibrillate, assess response, check carotid pulse, Maintain airway

options.label: D
options.text: Start CPR, Activate ERS, Defibrillate, Check pulse

questions.correct_answer: A. Assess the patient's response, Activate ERS, check carotid pulse, Start CPR
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Assess the patient's response, Activate ERS, check carotid pulse, Start CPR

questions.text: A 27-year-old woman comes to the emergency department with a 1-day history of skin rash. Two weeks ago, she had an episode of recurrent genital lesions, which began with small papules and subsequently became vesicular with ulceration, crusting, and eventual healing. On physical examination, she appears comfortable. Temperature is 37°C (98.6°F). Skin findings are shown in the image below. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Given the constraints and the need to ensure minimal nutritional adequacy, what should the minimum supplementation be in the Mid-Day Meal to support the children's needs?

options.label: A
options.text: 1/3 of the total protein requirement + ½ of total energy requirement for minimum 250 days in a year

options.label: B
options.text: 2/3 of the total protein requirement + ½ of total energy requirement for minimum 200 days in a year

options.label: C
options.text: ½ of the total protein requirement + 1/3 of total energy requirement for minimum 200 days in a year

options.label: D
options.text: ½ of the total protein requirement + 1/3 of total energy requirement for minimum 250 days in a year

questions.correct_answer: C. ½ of the total protein requirement + 1/3 of total energy requirement for minimum 200 days in a year
questions.explanation: Ans. C) ½ of the total protein requirement + 1/3 of total energy requirement for minimum 200 days in a year

questions.text: Which of the following is not a contraindication to the use of morphine?
A young patient presents with an oval, waxy white plaque on his right shoulder as shown below. He reports having a VZV lesion on the same site a few months ago. What is this phenomenon known as?

A researcher is analyzing the results of a study comparing two antihypertensive drugs in an Indian population. She comes across the term "p-value" in her statistical analyses. Which of the following best describes the interpretation of a p-value with regard to the probability related to the null hypothesis? (AIIMS NOV 2017)

options.label: A
options.text: Not rejecting a null hypothesis when it is true

options.label: B
options.text: Rejecting a null hypothesis when it is true

options.label: C
options.text: Not rejecting a null hypothesis when it is false

options.label: D
options.text: Rejecting a null hypothesis when it is false

questions.correct_answer: B. Rejecting a null hypothesis when it is true
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Rejecting a null hypothesis when it is true

questions.text: A 35-year-old factory worker presents to the OPD with severe back pain following a workplace injury involving heavy lifting. He is diagnosed with cervical disc herniation at C3-C4 on MRI. The patient is employed in an industry covered under ESIC and has worked there for 3 years. What is covered under the extended sickness benefits for this employee under ESIC?

options.label: A
options.text: 70% of daily wages per day for a period of 91 days

options.label: B
options.text: 100% of his daily wages for 3 months

options.label: C
options.text: 80% of his wage for a period of 2 years

options.label: D
options.text: Physiotherapy services for up to 3 years

questions.correct_answer: C. 80% of his wage for a period of 2 years
questions.explanation: Ans. C) 80% of his wage for a period of 2 years

questions.text: A 25 year old male patient was given cisatracurium for neuromuscular blockade. Which of the following is not true regarding the class to which the drug belongs?

options.label: B
options.text: Their action is potentiated by Mg2+ and antagonized by Ca2+

options.label: D
options.text: Characteristic train of four fade present

questions.text: A study assessed the association between a new vaccine and traveler's diarrhea (TD). Researchers selected a random sample of people who intended to travel to regions where they were at increased risk for TD and who had received the new vaccine and another independent random sample of people who intended to travel to the same regions and who had not received the new vaccine. These 2 samples of travelers were assessed for the occurrence of TD during the trip and for 7 days after returning home. What is the study design?

A primigravida attended to the antenatal clinic for the first time and was informed about a government scheme in which she will receive 6000 rupees cash in instalments for her first child. This benefit is given under which of the following schemes?
questions.correct_answer: C. Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana

questions.text: 61-year-old woman comes to the physician with a skin bumps on her trunk, as shown in the image below. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?
Which of the following LA would not need dose readjustment in a case of liver failure?

A pharmaceutical company has developed a novel diagnostic test for a rare metabolic disorder. In clinical trials, the test demonstrated a sensitivity of 0.90 and a specificity of 0.80. In a population where the prevalence of the disease is 30%, the test was applied to every participant. What is the probability that a person who tests negative truly does not have the disease?
Which of the following methods would be most suitable for removing microbial contaminants by chemical coagulation and sedimentation from a water body?
Under the National Urban Health Mission (NUHM), Urban Social Health Activist (USHA) workers are assigned to cater to a population of:

A 6-month-old boy is brought to the emergency department due to poor feeding, irritability, and rash. He was well-appearing until 2 days ago, when he developed little interest in drinking and a progressive rash. Physical examination reveals diffuse erythema and desquamation that is most prominent at the neck, axillae, inguinal folds, and perioral region. The perioral area also has crusting and the lips are dry and cracked, but the mucosal membranes are normal. The epidermis easily comes off with gentle pressure at the erythematous areas. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's symptoms?

options.label: A
options.text: Autoantibody binding to epithelial cell surface

questions.text: Based on the depiction in the accompanying image, which model is being illustrated?
Which of the following inhalational agents has the highest blood-gas partition coefficient?
Arrange the following corticosteroids in the order of increasing t1/2 (low to high). 1. Dexamethasone 2. Hydrocortisone 3. Betamethasone 4. Prednisolone
The combination of pulses and cereals is considered complementary food because they complement the amino acids deficient in each other respectively:
Which is not an obvious advantage of high-flow nasal cannula?
Identify the correct pair of BMW management: Human waste - Incineration Urobag - Microwave Vacutainer - Recycling Chemicals - Collect in chlorinated containers and send for disposal
Which of these is the definition of effective CPR? Respiratory rate: 20 - 24 breaths per minute. Chest compressions: 100-120/min. Allow complete chest recoil. 2-2.4 inches depression.
Which of the following histopathological findings is characteristic of acute eczema?
Which of the following non-invasive investigations provides the most accurate prognostic information with respect to predicting risks of perioperative cardiac complications?
Which of the following is false regarding services provided for high-risk groups under the targeted interventions of NACO?

options.label: B
options.text: Screening and treatment of sexually transmitted infections 1

options.label: D
options.text: Distributing sterile needles and syringes to IDUs

questions.text: What services are typically provided at a CBNAAT site within the National Tuberculosis Elimination Programme (NTEP) at district level?

A 65-year-old man comes to the OPD due to skin lesions on his back. He first noted the spots 5 years ago and says they are becoming more numerous. The lesions are occasionally pruritic but are otherwise asymptomatic. Medical history is notable for hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and type 2 diabetes mellitus. Which of the following is the likely diagnosis?

Out of 20 women taking contraceptives in a village, 7 women reported that they conceived accidentally. During the review period, the duration of exposure to the contraceptive was 30 months for all of these women. Calculate the pearl index.

In a busy OPD at a District hospital, you are evaluating a 5-year-old boy who presents with fever, generalized malaise, and a distinctive rash. The child's clinical presentation strongly suggests a diagnosis of measles. The mother, anxious about the contagious nature of the disease and the risk it poses to her other kids and family members, inquires about the recommended period of isolation for her infected child. What would be your most appropriate recommendation for the duration of isolation?

options.label: A
options.text: From onset of rash to 3 days after rash

options.label: B
options.text: 2 weeks before rash to 1 week after rash

options.label: C
options.text: From onset of rash to 5 days after rash

options.label: D
options.text: From catarrhal stage to 4 days after rash

questions.correct_answer: D. From catarrhal stage to 4 days after rash
questions.explanation: Ans. D) From catarrhal stage to 4 days after rash

questions.text: A 44-year-old man comes to the OPD with a 4-day history of severe left-sided chest discomfort. The pain is constant and has a burning quality. Over the last day, the patient has developed a rash in the area of discomfort. He has not had similar symptoms before. Which of the following pathologic findings is most likely to be found in the affected area?

options.label: C
options.text: Koilocytosis of the superficial epidermal layers

questions.correct_answer: D. Multinucleated cells with intranuclear inclusions

questions.text: A 27-year-old patient is brought into the casualty with maxillofacial trauma following a road traffic accident (RTA). He is unconscious with a GCS of 7/15 and his SpO2 is dropping with absent breath sounds on right side. JVP is raised. What is the next step?
Which among the given statements is incorrect regarding the interpretation of these plots?

options.label: A
options.text: The diamond shows the overall pooled results

options.label: B
options.text: Each rectangle depicts a single study

options.label: C
options.text: The vertical dashed line is the "line of no effect"

options.label: D
options.text: The size of the rectangle denotes the sample size

questions.correct_answer: C. The vertical dashed line is the "line of no effect"
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The vertical dashed line is the "line of no effect"

questions.text: 26 year old man presents with skin lesions as shown in the image below, and adds that new lesions that are appearing at sites of injury. What is the underlying pathophysiology?

options.label: B
options.text: Correct position of ET tube without removal

questions.text: As a Medical Officer at a Community Health Center (CHC), you're consulted by a mother about starting immunizations for her 13-month-old son who hasn't received any vaccines since birth. Based on the national immunization schedule, which combination of vaccines would you recommend for this child's initial immunization?

options.label: A
options.text: BCG, OPV 1st dose, Pentavalent 1st dose, Rota virus 1st dose

options.label: B
options.text: OPV 1st dose, Pentavalent 1st dose, Measles 1st dose

options.label: D
options.text: OPV 1st dose, DPT 1st dose, Measles 1st dose

questions.correct_answer: D. OPV 1st dose, DPT 1st dose, Measles 1st dose
questions.explanation: Ans. D) OPV 1st dose, DPT 1st dose, Measles 1st dose

questions.text: All of the following are true about the condition shown below except?

options.label: A
options.text: Topical steroids is the first line treatment for localised lesions

options.label: B
options.text: Histology shows lymphocytic interface dermatitis with basal layer degeneration

options.label: D
options.text: Non-scarring alopecia is typically seen in this condition

questions.correct_answer: D. Non-scarring alopecia is typically seen in this condition

questions.text: Identify the incorrect pair

Match the following types of psoriasis with the areas they commonly involve. i. Atopic dermatitis in infants ii. Inverse psoriasis iii. Dermatitis herpetiformis iv. Seborrheic psoriasis a. Flexural surfaces b. Extensor surfaces c. Para-nasal areas d. Trunk
Based on the emblem as shown below, which of the following best describes the warning it signifies?

Which of the provided options align with the depicted equivalence margin graph? (INICET MAY 2021) ‘A’ represents superiority of new treatment ‘I’ represents Inferiority of new treatment ‘E’ represents Non-inferior treatment ‘C’ is inconclusive
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 1, 2 and 3

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In equivalence margin graphs for RCTs, 'A' can indicate a superior treatment, 'I' an inferior treatment, and 'E' a non-inferior treatment. 'C' does not represent an inconclusive result; it represents superiority.
  • ➤ In equivalence margin graphs for RCTs, 'A' can indicate a superior treatment, 'I' an inferior treatment, and 'E' a non-inferior treatment. 'C' does not represent an inconclusive result; it represents superiority.

questions.text: A patient undergoing surgery is maintained on anesthesia. During the procedure, the patient suddenly developed the following capnograph. Which of the following drugs is most likely implicated in this condition?

A 2-day-old boy is evaluated in the newborn nursery for a diffuse rash that developed this morning and appears on the patient's face, chest, abdomen, and extremities. He has been breastfeeding every 2-3 hours and voiding frequently. The infant was born at 40 weeks gestation to a 30-year-old woman by vaginal delivery, His mother occasionally develops cold sores during stressful events, most recently a year ago. The mother also had chickenpox as a child. Physical examination shows scattered, blanching, erythematous papules and pustules that spare the palms and soles. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Bacterial blood culture and intravenous antibiotics

options.label: B
options.text: Contact isolation and cessation of breastfeeding

options.label: D
options.text: Viral DNA testing and intravenous antiviral therapy

questions.text: The image shows two data distribution curves from separate studies within the same population: one depicted with a red line and the other with a blue line. Given the graphical representation, which of the following correctly represents the relationship among the mean, median, and mode for the data presented?

options.label: B
options.text: Mean = median, not equal to mode

options.label: D
options.text: Mode = median, not equal to mean

questions.correct_answer: B. Mean = median, not equal to mode
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Mean = median, not equal to mode

questions.text: Which health program in India would provide financial aid to BPL families to help manage a child with major life-threatening diseases?

According to WHO, the safe limit of radioactivity in drinking water is Beta activity 1 Bq /L and Alpha activity 2 Bq/L. Surveillance is the performance and analysis of routine measurements while monitoring is the continuous analysis of systematically collected data.

A 4-week-old boy is brought to the OPD for his first well-child visit. He has been exclusively breast-fed since birth and has had normal urine and stool output. The patient takes supplemental vitamin D and no other medications. His 4-year-old brother has neurofibromatosis but is otherwise healthy. There is a 5-cm skin lesion with overlying hair on the upper back, as shown below. The remainder of the skin examination is unremarkable. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis for this patient?

Identify the correct statements? Rabies is an example of amphixenosis A disease whose pathogenic response is higher in children compared in adults is defined as hyperendemic disease Most efficient to control urban malaria is environmental control of larva CBR ≈ (8×TFR) + 1

A 56-year-old man presents with a facial lesion as shown in the image below. On examination, the lesions are painful & the edges are well demarcated & raised. Ear is also showing similar erythematous lesions. This infection is most likely to be caused by which of the following organisms?
All of the following are health care delivery indicators, except

A 42-year-old woman who is on SSRI for major depression for 6 months underwent hernia surgery. Post-operatively the nurse administered an analgesic for the pain. After some time, the patient developed fever, rigidity, restlessness, and delirium. Clonus is demonstrated on examination. Which of the following is unlikely to have caused her symptoms?

Identify the correct statements Role of Social factors in Disease causation is studied under Social Pathology Birth of a baby should be registered within 21 days Birth dose of BCG is 0.05ml intra-dermal >0.01 IU/ml tetanus antitoxin in the blood is considered clinically protective against tetanus

An 8-year-old previously healthy girl is brought to the OPD by her mother due to hair loss on the scalp. Several weeks ago, the mother noticed the patch of hair loss, which has progressively enlarged. The mother also says that the girl frequently scratches at the area. The child recently changed to a different school and has been anxious about new teachers and friends. Skin examination findings are shown in the image below. There are several enlarged, tender, occipital and posterior auricular lymph nodes. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's condition?

A study on 100 urban women evaluates potential risk factors for breast cancer using RR and 95% confidence intervals (CI). How many protective factors show a statistically significant association with breast cancer?
Which of the following is an advantage of epidural over spinal anesthesia?

options.label: B
options.text: Duration can be prolonged using an inlaying catheter

questions.correct_answer: B. Duration can be prolonged using an inlaying catheter
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Duration can be prolonged using an inlaying catheter

questions.text: A team of epidemiologists is planning to conduct a survey on the prevalence of malnutrition in a village. What is the correct sequence of steps involved in the planning of this activity? Establishment of objectives and goals Fixing priorities Analysis of the health situation Assessment of resources
Which of the following correctly describes the chlorine demand of water?

options.label: A
options.text: Chlorine which appears after the break point has been reached

options.label: B
options.text: Chlorine required to oxidize all organic matter and destroy the bacteria

options.label: C
options.text: Chlorine which prevents subsequent microbial contamination during storage

options.label: D
options.text: Chlorine amount that allows sustainable residual chlorine for 6 months

questions.correct_answer: B. Chlorine required to oxidize all organic matter and destroy the bacteria
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Chlorine required to oxidize all organic matter and destroy the bacteria

questions.text: A child came for DPT vaccination at 10 weeks with a past history of fever more than 40° C and inconsolable cry at 6 weeks following vaccination. What should be done next?
The image given below shows neuromuscular monitoring of the patient after anesthesia. What is the most commonly used cranial nerve for monitoring the same?

An 18-year-old patient presents with a contaminated wound on his right leg following a road traffic accident. He has received complete tetanus immunization, and the last dose was 7 years ago. Which of the following should be done in the management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: One dose of Td + tetanus immunoglobulin

questions.text: A researcher is comparing three different groups with non-normally distributed data and small sample sizes. Which of the following tests is best suited for analyzing this non-parametric data?
Which of the following is a secondary skin lesion?
All of the following anti-retroviral drugs are given orally except:

Identify the correct statements: FORD foundation is aiding in building toilets in India Normalcy of data can be measured by histogram, box-whisker plot and Shapiro-Wilk test Haddon matrix is a tool for prevention of injuries using epidemiology. The Reston ebolavirus is most pathogenic in humans.
Which of the following conditions is caused by herpes simplex virus?

A 70 kg elderly athlete undergoes surgery and is administered succinylcholine due to the unavailability of vecuronium. A total of 640 mg of succinylcholine is given intermittently. During recovery, the patient is unable to breathe spontaneously or move limbs. What is the explanation?

options.label: A
options.text: Pseudocholinesterase deficiency increasing action of succinylcholine

options.label: C
options.text: Undiagnosed muscular dystrophy and muscular weakness

options.label: D
options.text: Muscular weakness due to fasciculation produced by succinylcholine

questions.correct_answer: B. Phase 2 blockade produced by succinylcholine
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Phase 2 blockade produced by succinylcholine

questions.text: A 65-year-old man comes to the OPD due to a nonhealing ulcer on the left upper extremity. For the last 2 months, he has had an enlarging ulcerated lesion, with intermittent bleeding and itching. In the last 3 weeks, the patient has also noted local numbness, paraesthesia, and burning pain. He does not recall any injury prior to the onset of symptoms. The patient has a history of renal transplantation and takes an appropriate immunosuppressive regimen. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

Identify the correct statements Relieving pressure of pop off valve in AMBU bag is 30-40 mm Hg Morphine should be avoided in day care surgery. Ketamine is the iv anaesthetic agent of choice for severe asthma Propofol is anti-emetic and anti-pruritic

A 24-year-old woman comes to the OPD due to skin lesions on her trunk and proximal upper limbs. The patient noticed the lesions after returning from a summer vacation at a Goa beach a week ago. During the vacation, she had sun exposure on several occasions without prior application of sunscreen. The lesions are mildly itchy but not painful. Medical history is notable for hypothyroidism, for which she takes levothyroxine. Which of the following is the most likely cause of this patient's current condition?
All of the following can prevent the contamination caused by this pulse except:

options.label: B
options.text: Removing the husk of the dal

options.label: C
options.text: Soaking the dal in limewater overnight and then boiling

options.label: D
options.text: Limiting the amount of dal to a quarter of the total cereals and pulses consumed per day

questions.correct_answer: B. Removing the husk of the dal
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Removing the husk of the dal
